description:
Ciena is committed to our people-first philosophy. Our teams enjoy a culture focused on prioritizing a personalized and flexible work environment that empowers an individual’s passions, growth, wellbeing and belonging. We’re a technology company that leads with our humanity—driving our business priorities alongside meaningful social, community, and societal impact. 
 
 You know what your ideal career looks like: a competitive salary, freedom to live your life as you like, and recognition for your accomplishments—all in an inclusive and diverse people-first environment. Our success is driven by a supported, thriving team; this is why Ciena upholds these benefits for all our employees. Ciena empowers you with flexible paid time off, reimbursed and in-house development resources, support for mental and physical well-being, and assets you may need to attain your goals both at and away from work.
 
  How You Will Contribute:
  This is an onsite role at our lab in Ottawa. As a Lab Administrator you are a detail-oriented, dependable administrator reporting into the Senior Lab Manager. You will work with the Santa Clara and Petaluma and Ottawa lab teams, and learn about: remote Data Center Management tools to monitor and control the lab, help with inventory and lab assets counts, including lab space, lab racks, test instruments, etc.
  Other duties include:
 
   Handling lab equipment maintenance, and repair
   Install and prepare lab test gear for projects based on HW design team specifications
   Support lab safety protocols, ESD practices and good lab etiquette
   Ensuring asset tracking and inventory procedures are followed. keep an accurate inventory of all assets
   Answering JIRA tickets to keep lab in service and engineers productive
   Learn proper rack mounting, cable management
 
  What Does Ciena Expect of You: 
 
  A sense of urgency – what’s important to the customer is equally important to you. You make getting things done a priority.
   Integrity – you hold yourself to the highest level of personal and professional standards of conduct.
   A commitment to innovation – you continually seek to learn, understand new technologies and ever-changing market conditions, and endeavor to apply that knowledge to Ciena’s advantage.
   You embrace change – thriving in a diverse environment of ever-changing priorities and sometimes stressful situations.
 
 
  The Must Haves:
 
   Interest in Computers, HW & SW
   Experience in HW/SW development labs
   Knowledge of Lab Equipment: routers, switches, servers, and test tools
   Learn applications such as JIRA, CONFLUENCE, Artifactory, Bitbucket, etc
   Proficiency in written and spoken English
   Strong interpersonal skills
 
 
  Assets:
 
   College Diploma or University Degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or Electronics
   Programming and scripting skills, Web, Bash, Expect, Python, Java, A plus
 
 
  #LI-CM #LI-onsite
 
  At Ciena, we are committed to building and fostering an environment in which our employees feel respected, valued, and heard. Ciena values the diversity of its workforce and respects its employees as individuals. We do not tolerate any form of discrimination.
 
  If contacted in relation to a job opportunity, please advise Ciena of any accommodation measures you may require.
